intro: Palicourea fendleri, commonly known as desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent leaves and deep root system. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are usually blue or violet, blooming in the early morning. Palicourea fendleri is also known for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in treating ailments such as diabetes and inflammation.
